questions.question_text:
You are a marketing manager.
You need to improve the open rates for your email campaigns.
The content designer suggests you use dynamic messaging. You want the dynamic messaging to appear below the Subject in the recipient's preview pane of their email client.
Which action should you take?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The answer should be A, that's what the preview text for, right?
If "preview text" is Pre-header field, then A

choices.A: Use the Preview Text field to enter messaging with the contact's name, to entice the user to open the email.
choices.B: Create a custom code element that holds the following HTML information and place it near the top of the email <meta name=ג€descriptionג€ content=ג€Enter catchy messaging hereג€>
choices.C: Add the Preview Text to the subject field, preceded by a colon.
choices.D: Use the Preview Text element, and drag it to the top of your email in the email designer.

discussion.content:
Correct answer is D - max size is 100kb
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/marketing/get-ready-email-marketing#be-mindful-of-the-size-of-your-html-content

comments.content:
The question is a bit tricky, according to your link : 
- The max recommended size is 100kb
- The Warning message is displayed at 128kb 

I'd say D like you, but not 100% sure. If you just want to avoid the message, 128 would be ok.

choices.C: Make sure that the message has no more than 1000 characters.
choices.A: Make the message size less than 128 kb.
choices.D: Make the message size less than 100 kb.
choices.B: Make the message size less than 256 kb.

questions.question_text:
You are preparing an email message that will be attached to a journey for contacts that live in a certain city and have recently looked at your product page for outdoor furniture. While going live with the message, you receive a warning that the message is too large.

You need to avoid the warning.

What should you do?

DRAG DROP
-

You are building a marketing email for your employer. Before you send the email, there are a number of things you must include in order to pass the Dynamics 365 Marketing error checker.

Which of these items are required and which are simply best practices? To answer, drag the appropriate answer source to the correct email element. Each answer may be used once, or more than once. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

The legal department in your company indicates that new contacts *cannot* receive commercial tagged emails unless they opted in to receive them.

As part of the onboarding journey for new customers, you send a transactional email requesting that the customers opt in and informing them of the new privacy policy.

You need to be sure that you can send out the opt-in message without sending accidental commercial messages.

What do you need to set as default values on the preference attributes on a contact?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
It should be C, without permission for emails, you can't send even transactional messages to customers.
Regarding to the link https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-insights/journeys/email-properties I would say that C is the correct solution.
Why is it not C? You need send them an email to confirm their preferences so email should be allowed.

choices.A:
Bulk email is set to Allow.
Email is set to Allow.
choices.D:
Bulk email is set to Do not allow.
Email is set to Do not allow.
choices.C:
Bulk email is set to Do not allow.
Email is set to Allow.
choices.B:
Bulk email is set to Allow.
Email is set to Do not allow.

choices.A: Select the Delivery tab and download the heat map .PDF file.
choices.B: Gather the data from the Insights tab, then create a heat map image of the email highlighting the most-clicked regions.
choices.C: Select the Links tab and take a screen capture of the Click map for your report.
choices.D: Select the Interactions tab and export to Microsoft Excel.

discussion.content: According to this: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/marketing/insights it's the Links tab so the correct answer must be C.
C; but i first got side tracked by " take a screen capture" i thought a screenshot from the clicks ;-)

Selected Answer: C
Is this not C?
